FacilityName: The Hillshire Brands - Haltom City Mixing Center

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Scope



The EPA RMP regulation requires that an Executive Summarybe provided as part of this registration to the EPA.The following areas are addressed in this summary.



A. Accidental Release Preventionn and Emergency Response Policies.

B. Stationary Source Activities and Regulated Substances Handled.

C. Prevention Program

D. Five-Year Accident History

E. Emergency Response Program

F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety





A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



The Emergency response procedures are detailed in the TLC/Sara Lee SouthWest Regional Logistics Center Emergency and Hazardous Materials Response Plans and Procedures. These manuals were designed to meet the following objectives.



1) To save lives.

2) To minimize and avoid injuries.

3) To protect the environment and the public.

4) To minimize property damage.



The Emergency Response Plan had Procedures provides the reporting and notification procedures,evacuations procedures,and mitigation procedures that may be implemented to ensure operators respond effectively to an emergency situation. All employees are trained in there specific roles when responding to an emergency. The manuals are kept in strategic locations throughout the facilities and are readily available to all employees.



B. STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The ammonia refrigeration system is a closed loop system that cycles refrigerant, or ammonia, from a ligiud to gas and back to liquid again. The system, consisting of vessels, and interconnecting piping, valaves, and process equipment,cycles ammonia through various stataes(high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid,low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provide refrigeration for product and process equipment.



Changes in pressure are directly related to changes in temperature: lowering thje ammonia pressure lowers its temperature. Low-pressure(cold) liquid ammonia prov

ides refrigeration by removing ambient heat. Removal of ambient heat causes the liquuid ammonia (contained within the system) to vaporize. Heat is later removed from the ammonia as it is condensed back into a liquid. Typical operating conditions range from 5"hg on the low side to 190 psig on the high side.



Ammonia is used as a refrigerant in the refrigeration process.



The Maximum intended inventory of ammonia is 12,800 pounds.



C. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE AND PREVENTION PROGRAM



The facility operates in accordance with the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) giudelines and standards including the following:



IIAR Bulletin 107, A Suggested Safely and Operating Procedures When Making Ammonia Refrigeration Tie-ins



IIAR Bulletin 109, Minimum Safety Criteria for a Safe Ammonia Refrigeration System



IIAR Bulletin 110, "Start-up, Inspection, and Maintenance of Ammonia Refrigeration Systems"



In addition the TLC/SaraLee Southwest Regional Logistics Center has implemented a Process Safety Management program for compliance with CFR 29, 1910.119. This include an initial Process Hazard Analysis that is revalidate every five years. In addition, the facility has a Mechanical Integrity program that includes an Engineering Cxhecklist for equipment inspections.



D. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no reported release of ammonia at this facility over the last five years(New facility charged 12/05/2007)



E. Emergency Response Program



TLC`s Emergency Response Program is described in  their Emergency Response Plan (ERP) for the TLC/SaraLee Southwest Regional Logistics Center.

This plan includes planned responses and procedures for evacuation. Notification and alarm procedures are outlined in the ERP as well. The plan addresses training requirements for employees, including production employess, supervisors, managers, and operators. Emergency response drills involving all facility personnel are performed on an annual basis. This ensur

es that employess are familiar with evacuation routes from the facility and employee roles.



F. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



There have been numerous changes to the facility to improve process chemical safety as a result of PSM and RMP implementation. TLC/SaraLee Southwest Regional Logistics Center will maintain PSM and RMP programs for continued process safety improvement. This will be accomplished through audits, PHA revalidations, training, mechanical integrity testing and inspections.The facility is in the process of updating P&ID valve labeling.
